todolist.functions module

todolist.functions.assign_users_for_todo_item(todo_item, assigned_to)

This function assigns users to the todo item

todolist.functions.create_contact(data)

This function creates a contact and returns it

todolist.functions.create_todo_item(data)

This function creates a todo item and returns the todo item

todolist.functions.create_user(data)

This function creates a new user and returns the user

todolist.functions.get_csrf_token(request)

This function returns a csrf token that is needed to register and login

todolist.functions.get_request_data_of_register(request)

This function returns the parsed data from the request

todolist.functions.get_user(email)

this function returns a specific user by using the email of the user

todolist.functions.parse_due_date(due_date_str)

This function parses the date of the due date fields and returns the value

todolist.functions.serialize_and_respond_contact(contact)

This function serializes the contact and returns a response

todolist.functions.update_assigned_users(todo_item, assigned_to)

This function updates the assigned users of the todo item

todolist.functions.update_todo_item(todo_item, data)

This function updates the todo item data fields with new values and returns the todo item

todolist.functions.validate_contact_data(data)

This function validates the contact data fields

todolist.functions.validate_register_data(data)

This function validates and returns the data fields from the register

todolist.functions.validate_todo_item_data(data)

This function validates the data fields for the todo item

PRIORITY_CHOICES = [('urgent', 'Urgent'), ('medium', 'Medium'), ('low', 'Low')]
STATUS_CHOICES = [('to_do', 'To do'), ('in_progress', 'In progress'), ('await_feedback', 'Await feedback'), ('done', 'Done')]
assigned_to

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.
